text: Bodaybo Airport is a regional airport built in Bodaybo, Irkutsk Oblast, Russia during World War II for the Alaska-Siberian (ALSIB) air route used to ferry American Lend-Lease aircraft to the Eastern Front.Lebedev, Igor Aviation Lend- Lease to Russia Nova Publishers (1997) pp.44-49 In 2017 it handled 51 910 passengers. ==Airlines and destinations== ==References== ==External links== Category:Airports in Irkutsk Oblast
title: Bodaybo Airport
